result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Desmond J Howell

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

8:18 AM Defendant Desmond J Howell in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Desmond J Howell. Attorney appears as friend of the court.   Prosecuting attorney Ted Szczupakiewicz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Klein states she has yet to be appointed to the case, but assures the Court that she will be appointed and would like to proceed with the waiver of prelim.
The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:28 PM Defendant Desmond J Howell in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Desmond J Howell.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Klein will be appointed.  Preliminary hearing to remain as previously set.

1:05 PM Defendant Desmond J Howell in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Desmond J Howell.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. Preliminary Hearing requested. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Attorney Kleinn has not yet been appointed to this matter so the Court will set a status of counsel date the day prior to the preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
